website_summaries.verdict: Motorcycle gloves designed with thick layers and active heating elements.
pros: Built-in temperature control makes it easy to set the desired heat level while wearing the glove
Heating elements touch the large surface areas of the hand (palm and back)
cons: The sizes tend to run on the smaller side and may require the next size up for the best fit

customer_reviews.title: Not happy!!
customer_reviews.text: The connector from golves to power cord burt me. Not once but twice. Even after double checking i put in the provided pocket still burnt. Have two big blisters one on each hand.
customer_reviews.author: Jerome Watson

customer_reviews.title: Gloves worked very well. My hands were kept warm ...
customer_reviews.text: Gloves worked very well. My hands were kept warm on the middle setting while riding in temperatures in the mid 30's F. If purchasing in a store, I probably would have gone for the next larger size, but no time to exchange before leaving on the trip I was scheduled for.
customer_reviews.author: Mike S.

customer_reviews.title: Volt Heated Motorcycle Gloves
customer_reviews.text: Used these Volt gloves twice on a cross country trip in early December. First time in 30 degree weather, next time in 17 degree weather, both at interstate speeds. My hands were always warm at the lowest setting. I ordered based on review the next size up, they were a little tight but not enough to return, if I were to purchase again I would order 2 sizes up. Highly recommend these affordable gloves.
customer_reviews.author: melstrom1000Betty Bull

customer_reviews.title: One of the BEST, but bad location for Heating Control
customer_reviews.text: One of the best heated gloves I have used. I've been through some cold morning rides and I didn't have to go over the second lvl of heat. My only gripe is the Heating Control, the location is terrible. It has no clip it just dangles on the side, so while you are riding and want to change the heat. You have to fumble around feeling for it, then try and press the button without looking. Not safe at all.
customer_reviews.author: m maces

customer_reviews.title: Love These Things
customer_reviews.text: I live in the upper Midwest, and ride in all seasons. Whether I'm on my '15 FXSB or '11 FLHRC, my hands are always comfortable. These for sure work well, down to 25 degrees, which is my normal cutoff temp for riding, and would probably work just as well down to 18 degrees, which is the coldest weather I've ever ridden in. They compliment heated grips very well (on my RK). Absolutely worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Tony A.

customer_reviews.title: Decent heated gloves
customer_reviews.text: The reasons I give these 3 stars are as follows: 1. The first pair had to be returned as they had a manufacturing defect making it impossible to get them on on one of the hands due to an obstruction in one finger of the glove. 2. They make your hands sweat and stick to the lining which then pulls out when you remove them and it is a PAIN to get the lining back in. Aside from these negatives, they provide good heat and I love the fact they come with the controller and the wiring needed.
customer_reviews.author: Russell T

customer_reviews.title: Did buy again
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair of these a few years ago, then lost them when my bike was stolen. I liked them well enough, I didn't look for new technology or a different design. I bought the same gloves again, because they work. I seldom need them set higher than 1/5, and the highest I ever set them was 3, and that was for a short time. I don't have heated grips, and I'll ride in any temperature. I have no worries about keeping my hands warm.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Gloves, plenty warm
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are very well made. Sturdy construction, just slightly bulky but not enough to be a problem. I suspect they will be better when broken in. Good heat front and back . Colby (Volt customer support) was really helpful. had a problem with the fit. He sent me another size and told me to keep the pair that fit best and return the other.
customer_reviews.author: WRQ

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Worked very well in mid to low 30 degree temps on medium setting. Just order the size larger than you would normally wear for best fit. Definitely keeps your hands warm. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Goose

customer_reviews.title: Returned for the XXL pair - which is still slightly too small but I'm hoping that with a bit of use they will become more comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: My normal glove size is XL, these were way too small however. Couldn't even get my left hand in the glove, the right was OK as long as I didn't need to move my fingers... Returned for the XXL pair - which is still slightly too small but I'm hoping that with a bit of use they will become more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: RKramer

customer_reviews.title: Heat for cold hands.
customer_reviews.text: They are thick and will get very hot if you dont keep an eye on them but they will keep your hands warm at 38 degrees. Just watch out for the heating element wire coming up on the wrist area.....it can burn your arm.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Bates

customer_reviews.title: the part of the wiring harness that is worn needs better design to put it on- very awkward and time ...
customer_reviews.text: The Volt gloves are sized without the electric inserts, so you should consider ordereing the next larger size. Also, the part of the wiring harness that is worn needs better design to put it on- very awkward and time consuming. If you run the harness up your back, the control will be behind you. If you run it up your chest it falls off while pulling your sleeves on. It seems they only thought about powering the gloves via an electric jacket. Other products provide a necklace that solves the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Butler

customer_reviews.title: Keeps hands warm
customer_reviews.text: Actually too warm for a 55 degree ride a week ago, had to switch gloves. Rode yesterday for 2 hours in 40 degrees and hands stayed completely warm on the medium setting. Others in riding group had freezing hands, mine were toasty. Works perfectly so far!
customer_reviews.author: C J.

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: My husband loved these as a Christmas present! We live in Ohio and he tries to get out and ride as much as possible as long as it 50 degrees and above. So these are perfect for cooler days!
customer_reviews.author: Christine V. Lightner-Wise

customer_reviews.title: Extended my riding season!
customer_reviews.text: I've always suffered from cold hands and feet. The Volt Heat gloves work well and have allowed me to ride at much lower temperatures. Also a Great Value. I have already recommend them to several people.
customer_reviews.author: j. Rieck

customer_reviews.title: Finally, warm hands.
customer_reviews.text: Buy at least one size up, but fingers and thumbs get real heated. I am riding in 40 degrees VT in the fall and do not have to go above the second setting. Cables are different to have on but not a problem. Well made gloves, leather will never be like tough skin summer gloves for cold weather but is real nice. Could have made the fingers with a curve in them but that is only a side comment.
customer_reviews.author: N M.

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had to wear them yet, but I usually wear a woman's medium, sometimes small, and these gloves fit perfectly. Looking forward to some cold weather to try them. I anticipate they will work well with my Raynauld's.
customer_reviews.author: Alaska rocks... again and still

customer_reviews.title: Kept my hands and fingers warm and toasty
customer_reviews.text: I finally found the right glove for my riding. We rode in 27 degree weather and these gloves kept my fingers from burning and freezing.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Bigger gauntlet than Firstgear
customer_reviews.text: Heating is exactly the same as firstgear. Gauntlet is very long but full of insulation so its a little bit tight over the jacket sleave.
customer_reviews.author: mark

customer_reviews.title: warm hands equal awesome riding
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these gloves. They are the best pair I have ever owned. you will not be disappointed in these gloves. They keep your hands at the perfect temperature no matter what the temp is. I have riden my bike in 20 degree weather at 70 mph and I did not have any issues
customer_reviews.author: Eric Drake

customer_reviews.title: great heat
customer_reviews.text: Got these gloves instead of grip warmers. They are much better than grip warmers with heat on all sides of your hands and fingers. My wife had grip warmers until I got here these gloves and she loves them.
customer_reviews.author: Karlozg

customer_reviews.title: Work Awesome!!!
customer_reviews.text: Overall I think they are awesome. My 1/2 hr ride in cold has been much better. I also like the fact they include the heater controller... unlike other brands which Nickel and Dime you.
customer_reviews.author: Terese Wutke

customer_reviews.title: Have worked perfectly for a month now
customer_reviews.text: These work great. The controller has 4 levels and is easy to use. I use these gloves in 20 degree temps at 55-60mph and I'm usually on the lowest or next up setting.
customer_reviews.author: SilkMoneyLove

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Hands down the absolute best especially when combined with the Volt Heated Jacket!
customer_reviews.author: Ralph J. Shenyo

customer_reviews.title: good quality gloves.
customer_reviews.text: Seem to be good quality. Back of hands get too warm compared to the fingers. But that was riding HD trike at 55 mph with 5 degrees above zero in December in Alaska. At 20 degrees above they are perfect on 2nd lowest setting.
customer_reviews.author: Rod Bettis

customer_reviews.title: Does the job I intended it for when I purchased ...
customer_reviews.text: Does the job I intended it for when I purchased it. Keeps hands warm and dry in cold and wet weather.
customer_reviews.author: Marie Barber

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: These gloves work great at half the cost of Harley gloves
customer_reviews.author: jpm

customer_reviews.title: No more cold hands on those 30 degree rides,
customer_reviews.text: No more cold hands on those 30 degree rides, live in Maine and ride year round as long as the roads are dry
customer_reviews.author: David M.

customer_reviews.title: Love these gloves
customer_reviews.text: Love these gloves. They don't feel so bulky like some of the Gerbings I've tried out. Warms the top of your hand, fingers, and palms!
customer_reviews.author: HDS

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: WAY cheaper than gloves in shops - and they are comfortable too. Good deal. I ride all winter and these are excellent with the heated insoles
customer_reviews.author: KGB

customer_reviews.title: Very good heating to all fingers
customer_reviews.text: These are really good gloves. Very good heat to all fingers . I have only got to 2nd heat setting with 20 deg temp. Plenty of heat.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Roettele

customer_reviews.title: Heats well
customer_reviews.text: Heats very well. Extra large is a bit small but can make it work.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: These gloves work great even on the lowest setting
customer_reviews.text: These gloves work great even on the lowest setting. The only thing I would like to see changed is the cable lengths coming from the controller to the gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Better than I thought they would be. Roomy and insulated beyond the heating element.
customer_reviews.author: Marie Barber

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great heated gloves as expressed by others I had to go a size bigger
customer_reviews.author: David Wilkes

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: YOU SHOULD ONE SIZE BIGGER THAN YOUR NORMAL SIZE. WILL CHECK IN WINTER HOW EFFECTIVE THEY ARE.
customer_reviews.author: DAVID

customer_reviews.title: They are very good glove they keep my hands warm
customer_reviews.text: They are very good glove they keep my hands warm
customer_reviews.author: Gary L Collins

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I consider myself as someone with small hands and as a precaution ordered the medium. They do fit well, sizing a tad on the small side, so careful when ordering. And I do with the gauntlet portion was a little wider, bUT they work as they are supposed to!
customer_reviews.author: Shell

customer_reviews.title: warm but too small
customer_reviews.text: I bought the large gloves and they are still too small for my small hands. the warmth and wind resistance is great. They are very toasty even on the low setting. It's just that because they are so tight my fingers get numb from the lack of circulation. Unless you have very small hands I do not recommend these gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Jon E. Hooper

customer_reviews.title: Returned these gloves because they do not work with Harley ...
customer_reviews.text: Returned these gloves because they do not work with Harley Davidson equipment!!! They also did not refund me the original purchase price and provide me no reason do doing so. They kept 11.99 and I had to PAY TO RETURN THEM!!
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: My hands was getting dry
customer_reviews.text: I was commuting early morning 3:30 am from Torrance, CA to Valencia, CA the temp was around 37 F, after trying to use 3 gloves that I still was feeling cold in my hands I decided to give a try on those heated gloves, I used for 2 days and it was very good to feel my hands warm again but the only problem was that my hands were getting very dry, so I decided to return the gloves. Didn't worked for me but it might work for someone else.
customer_reviews.author: Max-carioca

product_meta.title: Volt Resistance 12v Motorcycle Heated Gloves
product_meta.description: Our 12v heated gloves are constructed with a rich, drum dyed, top grade cowhide leather with and a nylon cuff are exceptionally light, strong and flexible. With heating elements placed throughout both sides of the hand and the entire length of each finger, they will keep your hands toasty warm while riding even in the coldest of conditions. Simply install the included fused battery harness to your 12v battery, connect the included controller/harness and you will be connected to instant warmth and never have to worry about cold hands again.
feature_bullets: READY TO USE: Comes complete with a temperature controller with 3 different heat settings and battery harness with coax connector and inline fuse These gloves are equipped with everything you need to get out and ride.

12V HEAT: These gloves wire in to your motorcycle's electrical system giving you maximum heat output and maximum heat coverage, providing heat coverage the length of each finger on both sides, including the thumb, as well as the back and palm of the hand.

GENUINE LEATHER: These high-quality leather gloves are meant to not only keep you warm, but to ensure you stay comfortable on any ride. There is another layer of protection on the palm of the glove to help with grip.
GREAT FIT: Constructed with a pre-curved fit made for riding with adjustable straps for the wrist and the cuff.
INSULATED: Built for warmth using 150 grams of insulation and uses a waterproof/breathable membrane to help keep your hands dry.
